header.title: The Key of Solomon
authors: Traditionally attributed to King Solomon; compiled/translated by various esoteric scholars
header.category: Western Esotericism, Grimoire Tradition, Ceremonial Magic

central_thesis: The text presents a comprehensive, practical system for ceremonial magic, primarily focused on the creation and efficacious use of planetary pentacles to invoke, command, and control spirits, thereby acquiring knowledge, wealth, protection, influence over earthly phenomena, and spiritual dominion, all within a Judeo-Christian esoteric framework.

structure_content.summary: Introduces the general concept of 'Holy Pentacles' as figures and characters imbued with specific virtues for the Master of Art. Categorizes the pentacles by planetary attribution (Saturn, Jupiter, Mars, Sun, Venus, Mercury, Moon) and specifies the number of pentacles for each, along with a corresponding color association.

Details seven pentacles consecrated to Saturn. Their purposes include striking terror into spirits, repressing spiritual pride (using the SATOR Square), executing ruin/destruction/death, defending against hostile spirits, causing obsession, and exciting earthquakes. They incorporate Hebrew names of God (YHVH, ADNI, IIAI, AHIH), angelic names (Omeliel, Anachiel), mystical characters, and versicles from Psalms (lxxii 9, cix 18) and Deuteronomy (vi 4, x 17).

Presents seven pentacles for Jupiter, aimed at invoking spirits (especially Parasiel for treasures), acquiring glory/honors/riches, achieving tranquillity of mind, discovering hidden treasures, chasing away spirits, providing protection against earthly dangers, and granting assured visions (like Jacob's ladder). These pentacles feature mystical characters, angelic names (Netoniel, Devachiah, Tzedeqiah, Parasiel, Bariel, Adoniel), divine names (AHIH, AB, IHVH, IH, Elohim), and versicles from Psalms (cxii 3, cxxv 1, cxvi 16-17) and Ezekiel (i 1).

Describes seven Mars pentacles with virtues for invoking Mars spirits, combating diseases, inciting war/wrath/discord, resisting enemies, striking terror into rebellious spirits, ensuring victory in war, compelling demons, protecting the practitioner, and causing hail/tempest. They utilize mystical characters, angelic names (Madimiel, Bartzachiah, Eschiel, Ithuriel, Ariel, Tharsis), divine names (IHVH, IHShVH, Elohim, Agla, EL, Yiai), and versicles from Psalms (lxxvii 13, cx 5, xci 13, xxxvii 15, cv 32-33) and John (i 4).

Outlines seven Sun pentacles designed to control all creatures and angelic spirits, acquire kingdom/empire/renown/glory, enable vision of invisible spirits, facilitate transportation over long distances, grant invisibility, and free imprisoned individuals. Key elements include the countenance of Shaddai (Metatron), names of God (El Shaddai, IHVH, Elohim), angelic names (Shemeshiel, Paimoniah, Rekhodiah, Malkhiel, Chasan, Arel, Phorlakh, Taliahad, Seraph, Cherub), and versicles from Latin ('Behold His face and form...'), Daniel (iv 34), Psalms (xiii 3-4, xci 11-12, lxix 23, cxxxv 16) and Genesis (i 1).

Details five Venus pentacles primarily for controlling Venusian spirits, obtaining grace/honor/desires, attracting love, and compelling persons to come to the practitioner. They feature mystical characters, angelic names (Nogahiel, Acheliah, Socodiah, Nangariel, Aegalmiel, Monachiel, Degaliel, Schii, Eli, Ayib), divine names (IHVH, Adonai, Ruach, Achides, Elohim, El Gebil), and versicles from Canticles (viii 6), Genesis (i 28, ii 23-24), and Psalm (xxii 14).

Covers five Mercury pentacles for invoking spirits under the firmament, effecting things contrary to nature, acquiring understanding and knowledge, penetrating hidden things, commanding spirits for embassies, and opening closed doors. These incorporate Hebrew letters forming names of spirits (Yekahel, Agiel, Böel), mystical characters, angelic names (Kokaviel, Gheoriah, Savaniah, Chokmahiel), divine names (EL, IHVH, El Ab), and versicles from Psalm (xxiv 7) and a 'void restriction' sentence.

Presents six Moon pentacles for invoking lunar spirits, opening fastened doors, protection against water perils and tempests, defense against night attacks, gaining knowledge of herbs and stones, receiving answers in sleep, and causing heavy rains. They include mystical characters representing a door, divine names (IHVH, IHV, AL, IHH, Eheieh Asher Eheieh, Elohim), angelic names (Schioel, Vaol, Yashiel, Vehiel, Abariel, Yahel, Sophiel, Iachadiel, Azarel, Aub, Vevaphel), and versicles from Psalms (cvii 16, lvi 11, xl 13, lxviii 1) and Genesis (vii 11-12).

key_concepts.definition: A magical diagram, typically a disc or square, inscribed with divine names, angelic names, scriptural versicles, and mystical characters, consecrated to a specific planet for a defined magical purpose. Its virtue is intrinsic to its design and components, acting as a focal point for spiritual forces and a medium of command.

The system associates specific pentacles, spirits, colors, and magical virtues with each of the seven traditional planets (Saturn, Jupiter, Mars, Sun, Venus, Mercury, Moon). Each planet's unique astrological and symbolic influences dictate the specific magical operations and outcomes of its corresponding pentacles.

Sacred Hebrew names of God (e.g., IHVH, ADNI, AHIH, ALVH, EL, Shaddai, Elohim) which are inscribed on pentacles. These names are understood as potent expressions of divine power, acting as direct invocations and compelling forces over spirits, ensuring obedience and providing protection.

Names of specific angels (e.g., Omeliel, Netoniel, Madimiel, Chasan, Nogahiel, Yekahel, Schioel) associated with each planet and pentacle. These intelligences are invoked to assist in magical operations, acting as intermediaries between the practitioner and higher divine forces, or as direct operators of the pentacle's virtue.

Scriptural passages, primarily from Psalms, Deuteronomy, and other biblical books, inscribed around the pentacles. These provide a divine sanction and specific magical intent, reinforcing the pentacle's purpose by drawing on biblical authority and the inherent power of sacred texts.

Unique symbolic designs, often derived from planetary intelligences, specific spiritual forces, or occult alphabets. These characters function as condensed representations of complex magical energies, enhancing the pentacle's power and often serving as a 'seal' of its intended operation.

The process of preparing a pentacle involves specific material choices (e.g., gold for Sun, silver for Jupiter/Moon, virgin parchment), and precise timing (e.g., engraving on planetary days and hours). This aligns the pentacle with the appropriate celestial influences, charging it with the necessary magical efficacy.

practical_system.description: The system outlined in 'The Key of Solomon' is a comprehensive ceremonial magic manual for creating and activating seventy-seven planetary pentacles. The magic operates by leveraging the inherent virtues of the seven traditional planets, channeled through the precise inscription of divine names, angelic intelligences, scriptural versicles, and mystical characters onto physical talismans (pentacles). The practitioner uses these consecrated pentacles as instruments of command to invoke, bind, and compel spirits—both angelic and demonic—to manifest desired outcomes, ranging from material acquisition and protection to spiritual knowledge and the manipulation of natural phenomena. The efficacy of the operation is contingent on the correct construction, consecration, and ritual application of the pentacle.
tools: Specific Engraving/Writing Materials (gold, silver, virgin parchment, inks, specified animal blood like screech-owl or bat blood for certain operations)
Writing Implements (e.g., pen of the swallow)
Magical Circle (implied for various operations, explicitly mentioned for the 3rd Saturn pentacle)
rituals: Pentacle Construction: Involves engraving or drawing pentacles on specific materials (e.g., gold for Sun, silver for Jupiter/Moon, virgin parchment for Venus/Mars) at astrologically opportune times (planetary day and hour). Specific pentacles require unique inks or blood (e.g., screech-owl blood, bat blood).

Invocation and Command: Utilizes the completed pentacle within a magical circle. The pentacle is shown to spirits, acting as a visual and symbolic mandate for obedience. Divine and angelic names inscribed on the pentacle are recited as powerful compelling forces.
Versicle Recitation: Repeating the specific scriptural passages associated with each pentacle is integral, reinforcing the magical intent and drawing on the divine authority embedded in the text.

Consecration: Though not explicitly detailed as a separate ritual on these pages, the act of precise creation on specific days/hours, combined with the use of sacred names and versicles, implies a process of charging and sanctifying the pentacle for its intended purpose.

relevant_quotes.text: HERE FOLLOW THE HOLY PENTACLES, EXPRESSED IN THEIR PROPER FIGURES AND CHARACTERS, TOGETHER WITH THEIR ESPECIAL VIRTUES; FOR THE USE OF THE MASTER OF ART.
This Pentacle is of great value and utility for striking terror into the Spirits. Wherefore, upon its being shown to them they submit, and kneeling upon the earth before it, they obey.
This serveth for protection against all earthly dangers, by regarding it each day devoutedly and repeating the versicle which surroundeth it. 'Thus shalt thou never perish.'
This commandeth the Spirits of Mercury, and serveth to open doors in whatever way they may be closed, and nothing it may encounter can resist it.

critical_analysis.relevance: The Key of Solomon is a foundational grimoire within Western Esotericism, serving as a primary source for ceremonial magic traditions. It systematically codifies planetary magic, demonology, and angelology, influencing countless subsequent magical orders and practitioners. Its detailed instructions on creating and employing pentacles, along with its reliance on Hebrew mystical elements and biblical texts, establish a distinctive Judeo-Christian magical framework. The work's enduring relevance lies in its practical operative instructions for communicating with and commanding spiritual entities to achieve specific mundane and spiritual aims.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience consists primarily of practicing ceremonial magicians, occultists, and scholars of Western Esotericism and the grimoire tradition. Practitioners require a working knowledge of ritual magic, Qabalah, and Hebrew to fully engage with and implement the system. Scholars find it invaluable for understanding the historical development and practical mechanics of Solomonic magic.
